alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Mecklenburg and southwestern Lunenburg Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wylliesburg to near Dryburg to near Hitesburg. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chase City, Boydton, Kells Corner, Buffalo Springs, Fairview, Rogers Corner, Spanish Grove, Finchley, Fort Mitchell, Finneywood, Skipwith and John H Kerr Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
